...and fall in love with this idyllic town on the Devon Coast

About

Location

Finding itself not only as the only town contained within the East Devon Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty conservation area, but also at the start of the Jurassic Coast World Heritage Site, this town at the mouth of the River Otter leaves those seeking the best of English coast and countryside spoiled for choice.


Nestled between two popular holiday parks and only 14 miles from Exeter and the M5 and national rail links, Budleigh Salterton offers a fine choice for day trips, weekend breaks, or Staycations.


Boasting beautiful Regency era architecture throughout the town, an abudance of natural beauty, and a great base for visiting the Exe Estuary or the East Devon AONB, Budleigh is brimming with charm. If you're seeking activity and adventure you'll love our two mile long beach, our connection to a fantastic county-wide cycle network, and it's only a short journey to some of Devon's best attractions.

Getting Here

Road

Only a few short miles from both the M5 and the A303, Budleigh is easily accessible for any road users wanting to visit. It's also well served by the 157/357, 58 and 57c bus routes. Visit the Stagecoach Website for more information and to plan your journey.

Rail

With connections from neighbouring Exmouth you can reach us easily from almost any corner of the country via Exeter's rail links.

Air

Exeter Airport is only 11 short miles away, and with regular domestic flights to many of the country's airports Budleigh Salterton has never been easier to get to. Plan your journey now on the official airport website and travel here in style.
